question.body: Large proteins, such as insulin, typically transfer across the capillary wall via

response.feedback: Incorrect. Insulin is too large to diffuse through intracellular clefts and because it is not lipid soluble, it cannot diffuse directly across cells.
Incorrect. Bulk flow can only carry with it substances that are small enough to pass between cells.
Correct. Transcytosis is the most effective mechanism for transferring large, water soluble, molecules.
